CIS600 Applied Cryptography




Instructor: Yuzhe (Richard) Tang


Time: TuTh 11:00 AM-12:20 PM


Location: Shaffer Art Building 121




Reading materials






Textbooks 




Introduction to Modern Cryptography (2nd edition), Jonathan Katz and Yehuda Lindell, (
KL
) 








Other useful books




Cryptography Engineering: Design Principles and Practical Applications, 1st Edition, Niels Ferguson, Bruce Schneier, Tadayoshi Kohno (
FSK
)


Bitcoin and Cryptocurrency Technologies, Arvind Narayanan, Joseph Bonneau, Edward Felten, Andrew Miller, Steven Goldfeder, (
BtC
)











Grading




Class participation (10%), Homework (20%), Labs (35%), Exams (35%)


Technical review (5%) for CIS628

docs.text:
Project (CIS 628)


Timeline




Topic proposal: Oct. 04, 2019


Final submission: Dec. 08, 2019




Deliverables




Proposal (15%): one-pager including abstract.


Final report (85%): Formal survey of the technology with no less than 10 pages (format: 12-point font size on single-spaced 8.5" x 11"  pages). 
The report should focus on 
a cryptography-centric topic
 and needs to have the following elements for each technique surveyed: 
scheme definition, security definition, sample constructions, security analysis, proof and/or intuition
. 




Sample topics




Homomorphic encryption


Multi-party computations


Garbled circuits, oblivious transfer, etc.






Verifiable computations


Zero-knowledge proof


Adversarial machine learning and adverserial examples


Public blockchains
docs.title: Tech review
